RN.name: RECNO
RN.desc_long: Retrieval numer of record (Year/tape#/cut#) Year (2 digits), tape no. (3 digits), cut # (3 digits, alphanumeric base 36). Example: 850430B6

CU.name: CUE
CU.desc: Cue or time on tape, buffer (B) size, sec in buffer
CU.desc_long: ue Or time (min:sec) on tape at signal end, (B) analyzer buffer size (min:sec), decimal time sec from start of Kay buffer to cursor at beginning of sound. Example: 542 B2:8 8.130 or 1:03:12 B2:8 8.130

NC.name: NOCHA
NC.desc: Number channels recorded, digitized, chan/side ID
NC.desc_long: Number of channels recorded (1st digit), numer of channels multiplexed (2nd digit), channel ID letter (s) side one A &B, side two C & D~ Example: 42CD

SR.name: SAMTE
SR.desc: Sample rate (convert Kay input freq. to sample rate)

CS.name: CUTSIZE
CS.desc: Cut size -- digital cut in sec (2 or 3 dec. places)
CS.desc_long: Cut size sec (2 or 3 decimal places).

PL.name: PLAYBAK
PL.desc: Playback equip., filter setting low (L) high (H) kHz
PL.desc_long: Playback recorder If il ter type, settings in kEz (pass-band), L = low (HP) and H = high (for LP). Example: PEMTEK/KROHN-HITE LO. 1 H12

SC.name: SIGCLAS
SC.desc: Signal class - Signature, Mimic..., qual 1-5, Overlap
SC.desc_long: ignal class, letter codes (Signature, Mimic, Variant, Deletion, Uncharacteristic, Calf, etc. ), quality 1 to 5 (best), 0 = overlap in Time or Frequency. N = no overlap. Example: S 4 OTF

ID.name: IDENT
ID.desc: ID of individual vocalizing, species code
ID.desc_long: dentification of vocal animal, species code.

AG.name: AGE
AG.desc: Age, sex (M/F) pref ix, birth year, ID, spec,ies code
AG.desc_long: Age with sex (M or F) prefix (decimal for part year) and ID, birth year of vocalizing animal with sex prefix and ID, species code. Example: MO. 3FB19 M1985FB19 BD19D

IA.name: INTERAC
IA.desc_long: Interaction, male-male (MM)/ female-calf (FC), etc., with ID's. Example: FCFBI0 FCFB19

GS.name: GENSP
GS.desc: Genus/Species animals producing sounds, species code
GS.desc_long: Genus and species of vocalizing animal. Scientif ic names and species code.

GA.name: GEOA
GA.desc: Geographic location A = ASFIS code, species code
GA.desc_long: Geographic location area code from ASFIS map, species code. Example: ANABIA (AN area, ABIA species)

OD.name: OBSDATE
OD.desc: Observation date of original recording, species code
OD.desc_long: Observation date for original, species code. Example: 20-Dec-1960 ABIA /2 Subfield for month and year, species code. Example: DecABIA 1960ABIA

NT.name: NOTE
NT.desc: Note =. Species code, observation or recording details
NT.desc_long: Species code, comments, recording details. ID of animals in parentheses. Not indexed.

DA.name: DATE
DA.desc: Pate of this record entry (latest modification)
DA.desc_long: Date of this record entry, last modification.(Use F6 key) Example: 24-May-1991

IP.name: IDPRES
IP.desc: Identif ication conspecif ics present, species code
IP.desc_long: ID of conspecif ics present, species code. Separate subfields for each 'animal.

AP.name: AGEPRES
AP.desc: Age consp. present: sex-pref., birth yr., ID, sp. code
AP.desc_long: Age of conspecif ics present = sex pref ix (M/F ) wi th age (decimal for part year) and ID, birth year with sex prefix and ID, species code. Separate subfields each animal. Example: MO. 3FB19 M1985FB19 BD19D

BH.name: BEHAV
BH.desc: Behavior of the animals, species code

OS.name: OTHERSP
OS.desc_long: Other species present, species codes. Separate subfields for each species.

NA.name: NOANIM
NA.desc: Numer of animals vocalizing, species code
NA.desc_long: Number of animals vocalizing, species codes.

GB.name: GEOB
GB.desc: Geographic location B = name of area, species code --/2 Location of birth/capture area, species code, (ID)
GB.desc_long: Geographic location area name, species code. /2 Location of birth/capture, species code, ID of animal (in parentheses).

GC.name: GEOC
GC.desc: Geographic location C = lat. & ~ong., species code
GC.desc_long: Geographic location latitude and longitude,'N' or 'S' and two digits for lat., 'E' or'W' and three digits for long. Each with species code. Example: N70ABlA E020ABIA

OT.name: OBSTIME
OT.desc: Observation time of original recording, species code
OT.desc_long: Observation time for original, species code. Example: 1430 ABIA

SH.name: SHIP
SH.desc_long: Ship/cruise, aquarium, or other platform,(SMall boat, AQuarium, BEach, ICe, UNknown)

SL.name: SIGLEVL
SL.desc: Signal ievel ( dB received or source), species code
SL.desc_long: Signal level Received,Source, ( dB), species code. E = estimated.  Example: S172ABIA E

ST.name: SIGTYPE
ST.desc: Signal type codes, species code --/2 Signal type names (coda, slow clicks), species code
ST.desc_long: Signal type, Long= > 0.1 sec; Short= < O. 1 sec | BL Broadband long, noisy, many frequencies | BS Broadband short, clicks, pulses | NL Narrowband long, tonal, few harmonics | NS Narrowband short, bell, short tones | FM Frequency modulated, sweeps, 'contours' | CH Chirp, short FM sweep | PU Pulsed, click bursts, sidebands | SE Series, train, sequence of sounds | SO Song, long, repetitive, patterned -- with species code. Example: NLABIA /2 ignal type, general: coda, slow clicks, etc. -- with species code.
